DeleteClass.Title: Delete
DeleteClass.LongHelp: If you select one object, to also delete its children, select the Include structural objects option
DeleteHdr.Title: Delete
DeleteHdr.ShortHelp: Deletes the selected library or class.
DeleteHdr.LongHelp: Before you delete a library, delete all the child classes and before you delete a class you must remove all the content added to it.
MoveClass.Title: Move
MoveClass.ShortHelp: Moves a class to another library or class.
MoveClass.LongHelp: Ensure that the target library or class is in the same or higher maturity state.
Information.Title: Information
Information.ShortHelp: Opens the Information panel and displays the tabs that are available for the selected object.
Information.LongHelp: These tabs provide the information about the selected object like properties (for example title, maturity state, and owner). Click on each tab for more details.
ColumnVisibility.Title: Table Preferences
ColumnVisibility.ShortHelp: Customizes the presentation of the table.
Favorites_Add_Remove.Title: Add/Remove to/from Favorites
Favorites_Add_Remove.ShortHelp: Adds or removes the libraries or classes to or from Favorites.
Favorites_Add_Remove.LongHelp:
To add a library or class as favorite, select a library or class from the tree section and click this command.

To remove a library or class from favorite, select a library or class from the Favorite or Libraries section and click this command.
ExportAttributes.Title: Export Attributes
CreateNewClass.Title: New Class
CreateNewClass.LongHelp:
Select a library or a class and click this command to create a new class under it.

The new class inherits the purpose of its parent library or class and it cannot be modified.
CreateNewLibrary.Title: New Library
CreateNewLibrary.LongHelp: Select libraries section and click this command to create a library.
CreateNewDefinitionLibrary.Title: New Definition Library
CreateNewDefinitionLibrary.ShortHelp: Creates a library with definition purpose.
CreateNewDefinitionLibrary.LongHelp:
Use the Definition library to classify items using attributes that are essential and define the object. The essential attributes have a direct impact on the object and changing its value means changing the object.

For example, a screw is defined by its length, diameter and head type.

You cannot change the purpose of a library afterward after it is created. You have to create a new library.
CreateNewStandardLibrary.Title: New Categorization Library
CreateNewStandardLibrary.ShortHelp: Creates a library with categorization purpose.
CreateNewStandardLibrary.LongHelp:
Use the Categorization library to classify items using non-essential attributes that describe the object and have no direct impact on the object.

For example, screw reliability that can vary over time but remains as a screw.

You cannot change the purpose of a library after it is created, you have to create a new library.
RemoveAttributes.Title: Remove
RemoveAttributes.ShortHelp: Removes the selected attributes from the class.
RemoveAttributes.LongHelp: You can remove the classification attributes from a class only if it is in the Draft or In Work maturity state.
AddExistingAttributes.Title: Add Existing Attributes
AddExistingAttributes.LongHelp: You can add existing attributes to a class only if it is in the Draft or In Work maturity state.
ReorderAttributes.Title: Reorder Attributes
ReorderAttributes.ShortHelp: Updates the sequence of classification attributes added to the selected class.
ReorderAttributes.LongHelp: You can reorder the attributes only if the selected class is in the Draft or In Work maturity state.
ExportLibrary.Title: Export Library
ExportLibrary.ShortHelp: Exports the contents for the library as an xml file.
ExportLibrary.LongHelp: Select a library and click this command.
ClassAttributesTools.Title: Attribute Tools
ClassAttributesTools.ShortHelp: Lets you export, import, and upgrade the classification attributes.
DeleteAttributes.Title: Delete
EditAttributes.Title: Edit mode
EditAttributes.LongHelp: You must upgrade the attributes that were created in the IP Classification app before editing them.
downloadCAT.Title: Download CATNLS
downloadCAT.ShortHelp: Click to download the CATNls.zip file for all the attributes at once.
CancelUpdates.Title: Undo Edit
SaveUpdates.Title: Save Updates
NewStringAttribute.Title: String
NewIntegerAttribute.Title: Integer
NewRealAttribute.Title: Real
NewBooleanAttribute.Title: Boolean
NewDateAttribute.Title: Date
NewDimentionalAttribute.Title: Attribute with dimension
CreateLink.Title: Copy Link
CreateLink.ShortHelp: Copy link of library to share/open it later.
ImportLibrary.Title: Import Library
ImportLibrary.ShortHelp: Imports a library through an XML.
ImportLibrary.LongHelp:
Click this command and select the required xml file

Validate the xml file and import it
RenameCmd.Title: Rename
RenameCmd.ShortHelp: Renames the selected library or class.
RenameCmd.LongHelp: Click this command and enter the new name.
thumbnailview.Title: Thumbnail
thumbnailview.ShortHelp: Displays each item as a medium-sized tile.
thumbnailview.LongHelp: This view is useful when you want to see information about each items in a comfortable format.
datagridview.Title: Table
datagridview.ShortHelp: Displays information in a table that contains one row for each item.
datagridview.LongHelp: This view is useful when you want to see the most detailed information about items, and to sort or group them based on this information.
tileview.Title: Tile
tileview.ShortHelp: Displays each item as a small tile.
tileview.LongHelp: This view is useful when you want to see minimal information about each items in a compact format.
ContentSortByTitle.Title: Title
ContentSortByTitle.ShortHelp: Click to sort the content by title in ascending order.
ContentSortByModifiedDate.Title: Modified Date
ContentSortByModifiedDate.ShortHelp: The content is currently sorted by modification date in descending order. Click again to sort the content in ascending order.
AddExistingContent.Title: Add Existing Content
AddExistingContent.LongHelp: Click this command to search and add the required content.
AddExistingContentWebinWin.Title: Add Existing Content
AddExistingContentWebinWin.LongHelp: Click this command to search and add the required content.
AddExistingFeatureFromSession.Title: Add Existing Feature From Session
AddExistingFeatureFromSession.ShortHelp: Lets you add existing feature to the class.
AddExistingFeatureFromSession.LongHelp: Click and select the required feature from the session. Once the feature is selected it is added to the class Or Press Esc to cancel the command.
RemoveContent.Title: Remove
RemoveContent.LongHelp: If the class is in the Obsolete maturity state, only the Administrator can remove the classified content.
ReplaceByLatestRevision.Title: Replace By Latest Revision
ReplaceByLatestRevision.ShortHelp: Replaces the classified item by its latest revision.
ReplaceByLatestRevision.LongHelp: Select the classified items and click this command to replace them by their latest revision.
ReplaceByRevision.Title: Replace By Revision
ReplaceByRevision.ShortHelp: You can replace the classified item by one of its revisions.
ReplaceByRevision.LongHelp: Select the classified item and click this command and from the Revisions panel, select the required revision.
openWith.Title: Open With
openWith.ShortHelp: Opens the selected content in the suitable application.
openWith.LongHelp: Select content in the Class Content View and click this command. A menu of applications appears, select the one with which the content should open.
repeatCmd.Title: Repeat Mode
repeatCmd.LongHelp: When enabled, with each click it inserts an instance of the last item you have inserted into the root node of the product structure from the shortcut menu.
